intro: Benthamantha ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-flowered benthamantha, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of alpine regions.
